semantic_identifier: 161: feat: Fix follow-up task queue ordering and missing next actions + add telemetry

sections.text:
## Description

This PR fixes the follow-up workflow task queue so it reliably shows the correct “next best action” per account/opportunity and maintains a stable, deterministic ordering.

Changes:
- Reworked the queue query to compute a single canonical next action per account/opportunity (deduping multiple candidate tasks) and to consistently exclude ineligible tasks (completed/cancelled, archived, or no-longer-owned).
- Standardized ordering logic: primary sort by due date (nulls last), then by risk/priority signal, then by a stable tie-breaker (createdAt/id) to eliminate flicker and incorrect ordering.
- Fixed missing-task cases by ensuring queue invalidation/recomputation occurs on key state transitions:
  - task creation
  - completion/uncompletion
  - reassignment / owner change
  - CRM sync updates that modify due date, status, or association
  Implementation uses a centralized “task changed” hook/event handler so all write paths trigger the same refresh path.
- Added minimal production telemetry:
  - task-generation events (reason + entity ids)
  - queue-render metrics (counts, filtered reasons)
  - warning logs when an expected next action cannot be selected (e.g., all candidates filtered)

User impact:
- Follow-up queue should no longer skip newly created or recently updated tasks and should be ordered consistently by due date with risk/priority as a secondary signal.

Notes:
- No UI changes; behavior-only fix.
- Telemetry is low-volume and intended to validate correctness post-deploy.

## How Has This Been Tested?
